meanings.definition: Analyzing and breaking down a text or concept into its component parts
meanings.sent1: She enjoys deconstructive activities like taking apart old electronics.
meanings.sent2: The students will deconstructive the poem to understand its deeper meaning.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed a deconstructive trick, dismantling a watch and putting it back together.
meanings.sent4: The detective's deconstructive approach to the case revealed hidden clues.
meanings.sent5: The artist's deconstructive style involved tearing up paper and rearranging it into a new design.

meanings.definition: Tending to expose and undermine the assumptions underlying a particular text or theory
meanings.sent1: Her deconstructive critique of the novel challenged traditional interpretations.
meanings.sent2: The deconstructive analysis revealed flaws in the argument presented.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's deconstructive humor poked fun at societal norms.
meanings.sent4: The deconstructive approach to history questioned established narratives.
meanings.sent5: The artist's deconstructive painting style disrupted conventional artistic conventions.
